gtruth_answer: This in vitro test method is based on human neurons (LUHMES cells) at a stage of neurite growth. It assesses disturbances in (a) the mitochondrial respiration in general, and (b) individual mitochondrial parameters, by exposure to toxicants. The oxygen consumption rate (OCR) and the extracellular acidification rate (ECAR) are measured simultaneously using a Seahorse XF Analyzer. Basal respiration, acute response to test compound, ATP production-coupled respiration, proton leak, maximal respiration, respiratory spare capacity and non-mitochondrial respiration are determined. It predicts some aspects of neurotoxicity, but not all aspects covered by an in vivo neurotoxicity study (TG424).
